articles.title: New Orleans Has America's No. 1 Murder Rate. 'We're in a Crisis.' - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: A surge in violent crime has overwhelmed an already struggling police department and is motivating some business owners and residents to leave.
articles.content:
Violent crime in New Orleans has grown to the point that Ibrahim Rabee no longer feels safe at his auto shop.
At least seven people have been killed within blocks of his store since the beginning of… [+369 chars]

articles.title: Post Politics Now: Biden to meet with South African leader, relatives of Americans detained in Russia - The Washington Post
articles.description: The president has separate meetings planned Thursday with South African President Cyril Ramaphosa and family members of two Americans detained in Russia: Brittney Griner and Paul Whelan.
articles.content: The Democratic-aligned House Majority PAC is highlighting the presence of Ohio Republican House candidate J.R. Majewski at the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, in a new ad that pulls no punches. The 30-secon… [+403 chars]

articles.title: Extinct species that lived amongst dinosaurs discovered after 150m years - Innovation News Network
articles.description: Researchers from Smithsonian have discovered a new extinct species of reptile that inhabited North America during the Jurassic age.
articles.content: The reptile is described by scientists as Opisthiamimus gregori and is named after Natural History Museum volunteer Joseph Gregor, who caught the scientists eye after he spent hours scraping the bone… [+3846 chars]

articles.title: Why Ford is keeping its Mustang gas-powered as part of its electric vehicle push - CNBC

articles.title: Lebanese rejoice after Mayyas win 'America's Got Talent' - Sharjah24
articles.description: Sharjah24 – AFP: Lebanese celebrated the local dance troupe Mayyas on Thursday after it won the "America's Got Talent" TV contest, stoking joy and pride in a country battered by years of political and economic turmoil.
articles.content: Many fans, across age groups and religious lines in the crisis-tested country and its large diaspora, tearfully cheered the all-women group for what judges and viewers hailed as a hypnotic and mesmer… [+602 chars]

articles.title: Polio is back. How concerned should Americans be? - CNN
articles.description: An August report from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said that "even a single case of paralytic polio represents a public health emergency in the United States." CNN Medical Analyst Dr. Leana Wen explains why.
